review_title: Well meaning organisation with great people!
job_title: Corporate Client Manager in London, England

cons: - Needs transformation (but getting there!) - Pay is below market rate

job_title: Systems Analyst in Kings Hill, England
pros: Great employer, lovely team, clear goals and processes
cons: Not much personal and professional growth scope

pros: Work is rewarding in terms of the social impact of what you do. Good working hours.
cons: The business does too much. It would benefit from streamlining it’s services to become more comprehensive and competitive in their products and services and invest their money in the services most needed in the market and reconsider what their USP is.

review_title: Great company benefits but expect too much from low grades
job_title: Customer Service Coordinator in West Malling, England
pros: There are some excellent benefits and everybody is really nice. You get time out of work for schemes such as ‘day in the life’ to shadow other teams, or go to externally run personal development classes. There are also reward and recognition awards and regular activities across the division.
cons: They expect too much from lower grade staff on low salaries (expected salary for a charity though). The recruitment process for such basic roles is very lengthy and they come down too hard on people. Their staff would flourish if they were given a little more freedom.

top management too stale (but chief exec has retired since)

pros: good work life balance and supportive working environment
cons: Very limited upward mobility opportunity

pros: Friendly staff and a generally great place to work
cons: The salary scale is quite low but I guess it's due to be in the third sector

pros: - My manager was probably the only reason I stayed as long as I did
cons:
- No digital investment - digital transformation was misunderstood right from the top level and it was paper everything everywhere!
- No flexible working - didn't trust to WFH
- Dark ages policies like dress codes
- Polar opposite to a flat structure - emphasis on impressing Director's/writing emails in a way that wouldn't offend/highlight painful truths to them etc
- Archaic tech infrastructure (servers couldn't even manage google internally)
